OOC: All those who agreed to join the Tripreds, please confirm with me 
as soon as possible.

BIC:
(Location: Prima 1, moon of Cybertron)

  The chamber was a large, round, auditorium. It was purposely dark, 
lit up only in its center. The crowd gathered remained silent. 
  A door opened, and a shackled robot, massive, red, and slightly 
luminescent made his entrance. Everyone remained silent. He advanced 
until he took place under the pillar of light.
  A robot, in a ceremonial outfit, stood up in the first rows. He was 
not lit up, but his two optics, flashing an evil blue, glared at him 
more than anyone else's.
  Loremaster: Colonel Gorefeast, you are summoned here for the second 
time before the assembly of the superior officers of the Tripredacus 
Armies. You have served as a witness in the affair concerning the 
escape of the renegade. You were the one in charge of keeping him 
uncapable of harming anyone. You have failed.
  Gorefeast: I am aware of these facts, Loremaster. (He looked back at 
him, straight in the eyes, and took a cold and furious tone) Now spare 
me the details and give me my sentence!
  The Loremaster grinned, though no one could see him.
  Loremaster: Very well. For the charge of incompetence, you have been 
found guilty. For the charge of negligence, you have been found 
guilty. And last, for the charge of treachery and jeopardy against the 
Tripredacus, you have been found guilty. Your sentence is to be 
executed by your very successor.
  He turned his eyes towards a blue techno-organic robot.
  Loremaster: Major Tyrael, proceed to the center of this auditorium.
  The robot stood up and walked down, until he stood in front of 
Gorefeast. He was more frail, but his physic belied a greater 
strength. He held the prisonner's gaze, a gaze of hatred and anger, 
yet, with a part of despair in it.
  Tyrael: Loremaster, I choose to use the Tripredacus claw to 
terminate the traitor.
  His choice of weapon brought forth a rumor of satisfaction among the 
ranks. The claw was, unanimously, the best way to kill the traitor.
  He took a claw from someone in the first row. It had a main 
blade as well as two curved ones rejoining the middle one. When he had 
it fixed to his wrist, it began responding to him. He dug it 
effortlessly inside Gorefeast, and brought it out along with 
Gorefeast's still living spark, which was still attached to his body. 
The two sideblades then started to dig in the spark, and Gorefeast 
started screaming. This lasted a few minutes, until the spark was 
completely terminated and the Traitor's body then fell to the ground, 
the torture printed permanently in his face.
  Loremaster: The Traitor is dead. Now, Colonel Tyrael, you will be 
given this important mission. Go after Megatron. His survival 
threatens our now fragile plan. Make sure that he and his followers 
are dead when you are done with this.
  Tyrael: I accept this mission and will bring pride to the 
Tripredacus.
  Loremaster: You are given free choice to form the crew that will 
accompany you. Who shall be your officer in second?
  The blue robot thought for a few seconds, and looked at the 
gathering. I choose... (he turned to one particular bot) 
Lieutenant Shadow Star!
